required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Study of an Intervention Therapeutic Education for Patients Treated With Androgen Deprivation
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Study of an Intervention Therapeutic Education for Patients Treated With Androgen Deprivation

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

clinical_study.source: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to build and assess the feasibility of a therapeutic education program, constructed in collaboration with the urologists of the University Hospital of Saint Etienne. The aim of this therapeutic education program is to delay the onset or to reduce the amplitude of the development of insulin resistance and side effects of androgen deprivation therapy in patients treated with androgen deprivation in the context of an evolutive prostate cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who refused to participate

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients in all sessions

arm_group.description: patients attend three sessions of therapeutic education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients supported in consultation Urology at the University Hospital North Saint Etienne.
- Aged over 18 years
- Having an evolutive prostate cancer
- Patient treated with LHRH agonist for at least 6 months - Affiliated with the national health insurance system
- And having completed the worksheet informed consent to participate in the program.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of participation, protected or under guardianship patients.
- Patients unable to understand the study or unable to follow the educational sessions.
- Patient (s) with documented cognitive or psychiatric history.
- Geographical remotness (more than 100 Kms.)

facility.name: Institut de Cancérologie de la Loire
